Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer improperly refused to reconsider the application based on new evidence of a relative in Canada
Evidence_Assessment: New evidence of brother's residency in Canada submitted after initial refusal
Decision_Outcome: Visa application initially refused; decision set aside on judicial review
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate reasonableness of decision or procedural fairness breach
Credibility_Factor: Applicant's newly submitted evidence regarding familial relationship and brother's status
Legal_Rule: Visa officers have discretion to reconsider decisions if new evidence confirms a material fact
Procedural_Issue: Officer’s refusal to exercise discretion for reconsideration citing procedural fairness
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged unreasonable and overly narrow interpretation of discretionary authority by visa officer
Outcome_on_Merits: Not decided on merits; remitted for reconsideration
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Court found procedural fairness required consideration of new evidence
Key_Evidence_Considered: Proof of brother's residency in Canada
Legal_Framework: Administrative law principles, IRPA, procedural fairness (natural justice)
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged refusal to reconsider based on new evidence
Court_Result: Application for judicial review allowed; case remitted to another officer
Defendant_Response: Visa officer maintained decision was within discretionary bounds
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence (proof of relationship and residency)
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review and remittal for reconsideration
Outcome: Visa application to be reassessed with new evidence included
Decision_Authority: Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) – Visa Officer
Remedy_Sought: Reassessment of points under 'Relative in Canada' factor
Legal_Provision: Section 114(1)(b) of IRPA (discretion to refuse or issue visa)
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA s. 114(1)(b), principles of procedural fairness
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Lack of sufficient points due to missing relative information
Applicable_Process: Temporary or Permanent Residence Visa Application Process
Outcome_of_Review: Decision quashed, matter remitted for redetermination
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Reconsideration of visa application with updated points assessment
Jurisdiction: Federal Court – Immigration and Refugee Protection
Governing_Rule: Visa officers may exercise discretion to accept new evidence post-decision if it establishes a material fact
